intro: Covellia aurata, commonly known as the golden bell plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Covellia aurata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
